Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Board with the Remains of a Colored Picture
Description: A wooden board with the remains of a colored portrait of a woman, that may be dated to the period between the middle of the second century and the beginning of the fourth century AD. The hairstyle, which is parted in the middle, can still be seen as well as the face, which has large eyes that express sadness. The nose is long and does not harmonize with the rest of the facial details; the lips are small and red.
